inclusion.criterion: 12 leads ECG non-diagnostic for myocardial ischaemia or AMI
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: family history of young AMI (less than 50 years old)
inclusion.label: not_met
inclusion.evidence: not aware about his family history

exclusion.criterion: ECG diagnostic of AMI or acute myocardial ischaemia
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Congestive heart failure or hypotensive patients
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Persistent chest pain consistent with unstable angina
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: denied dyspnea, headache, palpitations, chest pain

notes: 62-year-old African-American man presented with left upper and lower extremity weakness, associated with dark visual spot in right eye, right facial numbness, facial drop and slurred speech. He is using Levothyroxine, Atorvastatin and HTCZ.
